item.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Observatory Completes First Cosmic Map Like No Other
item.description: The telescope will help scientists answer big-picture questions about everything from water deposits in the Milky Way to what happened in the first second after the big bang.

item.title: NASA’s Perseverance Mars Rover Ready to Roll for Miles in Years Ahead
item.description: The rover has been acing a long-term series of durability tests, making the most of its enhanced navigation capabilities, and ferreting out new findings about Mars’ geologic past.

item.title: NASA JPL Shakes Things Up Testing Future Commercial Lunar Spacecraft
item.description: As Firefly Aerospace prepares to follow its successful soft landing on the Moon, an engineering model for its next lander is being put through its paces.

item.title: One of NASA’s Key Cameras Orbiting Mars Takes 100,000th Image
item.description: Mesas and dunes stand out in the view snapped by HiRISE, one of the imagers aboard the agency’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter.

item.title: NASA JPL Unveils Rover Operations Center for Moon, Mars Missions
item.description: The center leverages AI along with JPL’s unique infrastructure, unrivaled tools, and years of operations expertise to support industry partners developing future planetary surface missions.

item.title: December 2025 Company Update

item.title: November 2025 Company Update
item.description: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. Design As the program continues to mature, we are releasing larger groups of parts through our design sprints. In November, we released 1,602 parts, unlocking downstream manufacturin

item.title: October 2025 Company Update
item.description: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch.
